name: GetListSellers
description: This endpoint lists all Sellers. This call's results can be filtered by [trade policies](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/como-funciona-uma-politica-comercial--6Xef8PZiFm40kg2STrMkMV#master-data) through the `sc` query param.

accountName.description: Name of the VTEX account that belongs to the marketplace.

environment.description: Environment to use. Used as part of the URL.

from.description: The start number of pagination, being `0` the default value.

to.description: The end number of pagination, being `100` the default value.

keyword.description: Search sellers by a keyword in `sellerId` or `sellerName`.

integration.description: Filters sellers by the name of who made the integration, if VTEX or an external hub. The possible values for VTEX integrations are: `vtex-sellerportal`, `vtex-seller` and `vtex-franchise`.

group.description: Groups are defined by keywords that group sellers into categories defined by the marketplace.

isActive.description: Enables to filter sellers that are active (`true`) or unactive (`false`) in the marketplace.

isBetterScope.description: The flag `isBetterScope` is used by the VTEX Checkout to simulate shopping carts, products, and shipping only in sellers with the field set as `true`, avoiding performance issues. When used as a query param, `isBetterScope` filters sellers that have the flag set as `true` or `false`.

isVtex.description: When set as `true`, the list returned will be of sellers who have a VTEX store configured. When set as `false`, the list will be of sellers who do not have a VTEX store configured.

sc.description: Filters sellers available for the marketplace's sales channel (or [trade policy](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/how-trade-policies-work--6Xef8PZiFm40kg2STrMkMV)) indicated in this field.

sellerType.description: Filters sellers by their type, which can be regular seller (`1`) or whitelabel seller (`2`).

sort.description: Narrow the search filtering by the fields: `id`, `name` or `pendingoffers`. The list retrieved can be organized in an ascending (`asc`) or descending (`desc`) order. The standardized format is `{field}:{order}`, and the default value is `id:asc`.

Accept.description: HTTP Client Negotiation Accept Header. Indicates the types of responses the client can understand.

Content-Type.description: Type of the content being sent.
